comments:
Umm, I got a strange error

I installed JRE 1.5 under eclipse/jre
Started eclipse fine
Now I shutdown :) delete the JRE directory (so it should use my 1.4.2 that is my default)
I also started with -clean and with a different workspace but I get the same error


org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The activator org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore for bundle org.eclipse.jdt.core is invalid
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.loadBundleActivator(AbstractBundle.java:151)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.start(BundleContextImpl.java:965)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:321)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:266)

at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.SingleSourcePackage.loadClass(SingleSourcePackage.java:37)
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass(BundleLoader.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.AbstractClassLoader.loadClass(AbstractClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))
at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredConstructors0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredConstructors(Class.java:1747)

Did I do anything wrong :)
Can you attach the complete log file?

Created an attachment (id=31739)
complete log

Ah ah ... the error occured on dec 13
I noticed there is something interesting ... :)

Caused by: java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: org/eclipse/jdt/core/JavaCore (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.DefaultClassLoader.defineClass(DefaultClassLoader.java:370)

Which leads me to think I somehow compiled this class using JDK 5 ??? or ? :)

hmmm... Did you get the jdt plugins from a published build or did you build/export them from your workspace and then run with your built versions?  If you built your own versions then it does look like your compiler settings may have been set incorrectly which caused class files to be generated which the 1.4.2 VM could not understand.

If this is true then this bug is invalid, but if you are running with published plugins then we have a bigger issue :)

Ummm to tell you the truth I do not believe I rebuilt JDTCore
I am developing plugins though

I think..yeah
I installed 3.2, I had JDK 5 as OS jdk
Then I removed it and got this error
so I installed JDK 5 under JRE

Is there anything else you want me to do ? I can get 3.1.1, get JRE 5 under jre, create workspace, shutdown, remove jre 5 and try to start with jre 1.42 ?

Bouhahahahahaha :)

My mistake :)
I installed APT: http://www.eclipse.org/jdt/apt/index.html
Which seems to have replaced my JDT Core... by a version compiled with JDK 5

Ok I guess I can close this one :)
